answer: 2 eggs, 1 t. salt, 1/2 c. cold strong Kona coffee, 1 1/2 c. sugar, 2 1/2 c. sifted cake flour, 1 T. baking soda, 2 t. vanilla, 1/3 c. salad oil, Beat egg whites until foamy; gradually beat in 1/2 cup sugar. Beat until stiff and glossy. Sift remaining sugar, flour, baking powder and salt together. Make a well in center of dry ingredients. Combine coffee, milk, baking soda and vanilla. Add salad oil and one-half the coffee mixture to dry ingredients; beat 1 min. at medium speed 150 strokes by hand. Add remaining coffee mixture and egg yolks and beat additional min. Fold eggs whites into batter gently but thoroughly. Pour into two greased and floured 8-inch cake pans. Bake at 350 degrees for 30-35 minutes. Remove from pans; cool. Split each layer into two layers. Fill and frost with any compatible frosting. Yield: 8-10 servings.
